subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to test console output?
msgSnippet: ... Of course I let Eclipse generate the test class template, too. I just press finish before I even get to the point where I could specify which methods to
messageBody:
jxingtang wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@d...> wrote:
>> jxingtang wrote:
>>
>>> Well, I use Eclipse with JUB plugin to automatically generate Junit
>>> test class. For each method being tested, only one corresponding
>>> method in the test class will be generated.
>>
>> Yes. But that's nonsense - don't use those automatically generated
>> test methods.
>
> It is still not too bad to have it generate test class template. Now
> it seems that we need to extend the template to include more test
> cases.

Of course I let Eclipse generate the test class template, too. I just
press "finish" before I even get to the point where I could specify
which methods to automatically generate... ;)

> Actually I believe that it is common issue. Seldom a method has just
> one test case.

Yes.

> I used One and Two just for illustration here. Your suggestion is
> still quite valuable for me.

I see. :)

> Thanks a lot for your input!

You're welcome!
